{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Inventory Officer",
  "description": "Rotic Aluminium Extrusion -&nbsp;We are a steadily growing aluminium extrusion company in Anambra. We are dedicated to delivering the highest standard of aluminium extrusion profiles. Our seasoned team of experts ensures that each product we create embodies precision and craftsmanship.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Inventory Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Awka, Anambra
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are currently seeking a meticulous and detail-oriented individual to join our team as an Inventory Officer at our facility in Awka, Anambra State.
	The Inventory Officer will be responsible for overseeing and managing inventory levels to ensure accuracy and efficiency in our operations.


Responsibilities


	Maintain accurate records of inventory levels, including stock counts, movements, and adjustments.
	Conduct regular inventory audits to reconcile physical stock with system records.
	Coordinate with procurement and warehouse teams for timely inventory receipt and storage.
	Handle inventory issuance and returns, resolving any discrepancies.
	Generate reports on inventory status, stock movements, and variances for management review.
	Implement and uphold inventory control procedures to minimize losses.
	Generate reports on inventory status and collaborate with departments for future stock needs.
	Ensure compliance with company policies and regulations.


Requirements


	Minimum of an OND certification in any related field
	1 year of inventory management experience.
	Proficiency in inventory management software and Microsoft Excel.
	Strong organizational and communication skills.
	Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
	Ability to analyze data and generate reports to support decision-making.
	Willingness to adapt to changing priorities and learn new systems or processes.


Benefits We Offer


	Salary: N120,000 - N150,000 monthly.
	Comfortable accommodation.
	A free meal daily.
	Solid bonus system.
	Medical bills coverage.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;jobs@roticaluminium.com&nbsp;using&nbsp;&ldquo;Inventory Officer&rdquo;&nbsp;as the subject of the email.",

  "validThrough": "2026-01-21",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Rotic Aluminium"
    
  },

    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",

       "streetAddress": ". ",

      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {

  },

}



Inventory Officer Job at Rotic Aluminium Extrusion




        
    

        
        Rotic Aluminium Extrusion - We are a steadily growing aluminium extrusion company in Anambra. We are dedicated to delivering the highest standard of aluminium extrusion profiles. Our seasoned team of experts ensures that each product we create embodies precision and craftsmanship.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Inventory Officer

Job Location: Awka, Anambra
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are currently seeking a meticulous and detail-oriented individual to join our team as an Inventory Officer at our facility in Awka, Anambra State.
	The Inventory Officer will be responsible for overseeing and managing inventory levels to ensure accuracy and efficiency in our operations.


Responsibilities


	Maintain accurate records of inventory levels, including stock counts, movements, and adjustments.
	Conduct regular inventory audits to reconcile physical stock with system records.
	Coordinate with procurement and warehouse teams for timely inventory receipt and storage.
	Handle inventory issuance and returns, resolving any discrepancies.
	Generate reports on inventory status, stock movements, and variances for management review.
	Implement and uphold inventory control procedures to minimize losses.
	Generate reports on inventory status and collaborate with departments for future stock needs.
	Ensure compliance with company policies and regulations.


Requirements


	Minimum of an OND certification in any related field
	1 year of inventory management experience.
	Proficiency in inventory management software and Microsoft Excel.
	Strong organizational and communication skills.
	Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
	Ability to analyze data and generate reports to support decision-making.
	Willingness to adapt to changing priorities and learn new systems or processes.


Benefits We Offer


	Salary: N120,000 - N150,000 monthly.
	Comfortable accommodation.
	A free meal daily.
	Solid bonus system.
	Medical bills coverage.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: jobs@roticaluminium.com using “Inventory Officer” as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "School Administrator",
  "description": "The Lamb Academy is a newly established schoollocated along Lotto/Shimawa Road, Mowe they offer-spacious and learning-friendly classrooms, well-equipped science laboratories, and specially designed rooms for art, music, and life science; to ensure a well-rounded education for the students, Mowecampus also has the following in-place for sports and recreational activities:- swimming pools, athletics track, basketball courts, football pitches, and tennis courts, all set in a safe and secure school environment.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: School Administrator
Job Location:&nbsp;Mowe / Shimawa, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Job&nbsp;Brief


	We are looking for a School Administrator to manage all administrative tasks in our school.
	As a School Administrator, you&rsquo;ll need to wear many different hats; the planner, the problem-solver, the educator and the counselor being a few of them. You should have the skills to communicate with various people, handle budgets and logistics, and keep all educational programs running.
	If you&rsquo;re up to the task, and you&rsquo;re also committed to high-quality education, we&rsquo;d like to meet you.


Responsibilities


	Manage budgets, logistics and events or meetings
	Handle scheduling, record-keeping and reporting
	Ensure the school complies with relevant laws and regulations
	Develop and run educational programs
	Hire, train and advise staff
	Counsel students when needed
	Resolve conflicts and other issues
	Communicate with parents, regulatory bodies and the public
	Have a hand in the creation of the school curriculum
	Implement actions that improve the school and the quality of education (e.g. building renovations, new guidelines for students, new subjects)
	Help shape and uphold the vision of the school.


Requirements and Skills


	Degree in Education or similar field; post-graduate Degree is a plus
	Proven experience as a School Administrator
	Must reside around Mowe, Lotto Asese,Olowotedo and it&#39;s environment.
	Experience as an educator is a plus
	Knowledge of administrative processes of schools
	Ability to use computers (e.g. MS Office) and education management systems
	Excellent communication skills
	Outstanding organizational ability
	Attention to detail
	Problem-solving and conflict resolution skills
	Good judgment and decision-making aptitude.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to:&nbsp;kingdom.lamb2023@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

  "validThrough": "2026-01-13",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "@type": "Organization",

  },

School Administrator Job at the Lamb Academy




        
    

        
        The Lamb Academy is a newly established schoollocated along Lotto/Shimawa Road, Mowe they offer-spacious and learning-friendly classrooms, well-equipped science laboratories, and specially designed rooms for art, music, and life science; to ensure a well-rounded education for the students, Mowecampus also has the following in-place for sports and recreational activities:- swimming pools, athletics track, basketball courts, football pitches, and tennis courts, all set in a safe and secure school environment.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: School Administrator
Job Location: Mowe / Shimawa, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Brief
     

            
    




	We are looking for a School Administrator to manage all administrative tasks in our school.
	As a School Administrator, you’ll need to wear many different hats; the planner, the problem-solver, the educator and the counselor being a few of them. You should have the skills to communicate with various people, handle budgets and logistics, and keep all educational programs running.
	If you’re up to the task, and you’re also committed to high-quality education, we’d like to meet you.


Responsibilities


	Manage budgets, logistics and events or meetings
	Handle scheduling, record-keeping and reporting
	Ensure the school complies with relevant laws and regulations
	Develop and run educational programs
	Hire, train and advise staff
	Counsel students when needed
	Resolve conflicts and other issues
	Communicate with parents, regulatory bodies and the public
	Have a hand in the creation of the school curriculum
	Implement actions that improve the school and the quality of education (e.g. building renovations, new guidelines for students, new subjects)
	Help shape and uphold the vision of the school.


Requirements and Skills


	Degree in Education or similar field; post-graduate Degree is a plus
	Proven experience as a School Administrator
	Must reside around Mowe, Lotto Asese,Olowotedo and it's environment.
	Experience as an educator is a plus
	Knowledge of administrative processes of schools
	Ability to use computers (e.g. MS Office) and education management systems
	Excellent communication skills
	Outstanding organizational ability
	Attention to detail
	Problem-solving and conflict resolution skills
	Good judgment and decision-making aptitude.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to: kingdom.lamb2023@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "HMO / Billing Officer",
  "description": "Zael consulting is basically a recruitment firm. We offer clients and candidates the confidence of specialist recruiters the have the depth and breath of experience across key sectors.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HMO / Billing Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	We are seeking a detail-oriented HMO/Billing Officer to manage patient billing, process HMO claims, and ensure accurate documentation and timely reconciliation of payments.


Key Responsibilities


	Generate and manage patient bills (HMO, cash, and corporate)
	Process HMO claims, pre-authorizations, and follow-ups
	Liaise with HMOs to resolve billing and payment issues
	Ensure accurate coding and documentation of services rendered
	Reconcile bills, payments, and outstanding balances
	Work closely with front desk, medical records, and clinical teams
	Maintain confidentiality and accurate billing records.


Requirements &amp; Qualifications


	OND / HND / BSc in Accounting, Business Administration, or related field
	Minimum 2-4 years of experience in hospital billing or HMO processing
	Good knowledge of HMO operations and claims management
	Proficiency in hospital billing systems and Microsoft Excel
	Strong attention to detail and organizational skills
	Good communication and interpersonal skills.


Salary
N150,000 - N250,000 monthly.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their application to:&nbsp;&nbsp; info@zaelconsulting.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

HMO / Billing Officer Job at Zael Business Management & Consulting




        
    

        
        Zael consulting is basically a recruitment firm. We offer clients and candidates the confidence of specialist recruiters the have the depth and breath of experience across key sectors.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HMO / Billing Officer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	We are seeking a detail-oriented HMO/Billing Officer to manage patient billing, process HMO claims, and ensure accurate documentation and timely reconciliation of payments.


Key Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Generate and manage patient bills (HMO, cash, and corporate)
	Process HMO claims, pre-authorizations, and follow-ups
	Liaise with HMOs to resolve billing and payment issues
	Ensure accurate coding and documentation of services rendered
	Reconcile bills, payments, and outstanding balances
	Work closely with front desk, medical records, and clinical teams
	Maintain confidentiality and accurate billing records.


Requirements & Qualifications


	OND / HND / BSc in Accounting, Business Administration, or related field
	Minimum 2-4 years of experience in hospital billing or HMO processing
	Good knowledge of HMO operations and claims management
	Proficiency in hospital billing systems and Microsoft Excel
	Strong attention to detail and organizational skills
	Good communication and interpersonal skills.


Salary
N150,000 - N250,000 monthly.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their application to:   info@zaelconsulting.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Business Development Executive",
  "description": "Prestigious Consulting is a professional HR consultancy firm. We focus on improving organizational performance through strategic people &amp; process management.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Executive

Job Location:&nbsp;Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are looking for an ambitious and result-driven Business Development Executive to identify growth opportunities, strengthen client relationships, and expand the organization&rsquo;s market presence.
	The candidate will play a critical role in developing partnerships, increasing patient engagement, and achieving business growth targets.


Key Responsibilities


	Identify and pursue new business and partnership opportunities within the healthcare sector.
	Develop strategies to increase patient registration and corporate client engagement.
	Build and maintain strong relationships with existing and prospective clients.
	Prepare business proposals, presentations, and growth strategies.
	Conduct market research to identify emerging opportunities and trends.
	Meet and exceed monthly and quarterly business development targets.
	Work closely with management to align sales and marketing efforts.


Requirements


	B.Sc Degree / HND qualification in Business Administration, Marketing, or related discipline.
	Minimum of 2 &ndash; 5 years of experience in business development or sales.
	Healthcare or service industry experience is an added advantage.
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills.
	Self-motivated, target-driven, and customer-oriented.


Salary
N200,000 - N250,000 monthly.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hrprestigiousconsulting@outlook.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

  "validThrough": "2025-12-31",

  },

Business Development Executive Job at Prestigious Consulting




        
    

        
        Prestigious Consulting is a professional HR consultancy firm. We focus on improving organizational performance through strategic people & process management.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Executive

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

            
    




	We are looking for an ambitious and result-driven Business Development Executive to identify growth opportunities, strengthen client relationships, and expand the organization’s market presence.
	The candidate will play a critical role in developing partnerships, increasing patient engagement, and achieving business growth targets.


Key Responsibilities


	Identify and pursue new business and partnership opportunities within the healthcare sector.
	Develop strategies to increase patient registration and corporate client engagement.
	Build and maintain strong relationships with existing and prospective clients.
	Prepare business proposals, presentations, and growth strategies.
	Conduct market research to identify emerging opportunities and trends.
	Meet and exceed monthly and quarterly business development targets.
	Work closely with management to align sales and marketing efforts.


Requirements


	B.Sc Degree / HND qualification in Business Administration, Marketing, or related discipline.
	Minimum of 2 – 5 years of experience in business development or sales.
	Healthcare or service industry experience is an added advantage.
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills.
	Self-motivated, target-driven, and customer-oriented.


Salary
N200,000 - N250,000 monthly.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hrprestigiousconsulting@outlook.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply
